intro: Oxandra maya, commonly known as Maya beauty, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a fragrant scent. Oxandra maya produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
